intro: Jeffersonia manchuriensis, commonly known as the Manchurian jeffersonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its woody stems and evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
